function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased threat to wildlife in poorer countries due to decreased economic capacity in pandemic areas, leading to difficulties in conserving endangered species and habitats.","Impact":"Loss of biodiversity, potential extinction of endangered species, and degradation of natural habitats.","Mitigation":"International aid and support, fundraising for conservation efforts, and sustainable development initiatives in affected regions.","Technologies":"Remote monitoring and surveillance technology, conservation drones, and satellite tracking.","People":"Wildlife in poorer countries, conservation organizations, and local communities in affected regions.","Owner":"International organizations, conservation NGOs, and governments of wealthier nations."},{"Description":"Increased conflict between wildlife and urban areas due to human absence during lockdowns, leading to potential harm to both wildlife and humans.","Impact":"Risk of traffic accidents involving wildlife, increased human-wildlife conflicts, and potential harm to wildlife and human populations.","Mitigation":"Urban wildlife management strategies, public awareness campaigns, and implementation of wildlife crossing structures and warning systems.","Technologies":"Wildlife tracking and monitoring systems, intelligent transportation systems, and wildlife detection sensors.","People":"Local communities, urban planners, and wildlife conservation organizations.","Owner":"Local governments, transportation authorities, and wildlife conservation organizations."},{"Description":"Reliance on intermittent social lockdowns to nurture nature may disrupt human livelihoods and economic stability, especially in resource-dependent communities.","Impact":"Loss of income, food insecurity, and economic instability in communities relying on natural resource-based livelihoods.","Mitigation":"Diversification of livelihoods, investment in alternative sustainable industries, and development of social safety nets for affected communities.","Technologies":"Remote work and telecommuting technologies, sustainable agriculture and fisheries practices, and digital financial inclusion tools.","People":"Communities in resource-dependent areas, small-scale farmers, and fishing communities.","Owner":"Local governments, NGOs, and sustainable development organizations."}]}
